net.jodah.recurrent

Class RetryPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.recurrent.RetryPolicy

  • public final class RetryPolicy
extends Object
    A policy that defines when retries should be performed.

    The retryOn methods describe when a retry should be performed for a particular failure. The retryWhen methods describe when a retry should be performed for a particular result. If multiple retryOn or retryWhen conditions are specified, any matching condition can allow a retry.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RetryPolicy()
      Creates a retry policy that always retries with no delay.
      RetryPolicy(RetryPolicy rp)
      Copy constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • allowsRetries

        public boolean allowsRetries()
        Returns whether the policy allows any retries based on the configured maxRetries and maxDuration.

      • allowsRetriesFor

        public boolean allowsRetriesFor(Object result,
                                Throwable failure)
        Returns whether the policy will allow retries for the failure.

      • copy

        public RetryPolicy copy()
        Returns a copy of this RetryPolicy.

      • getDelay

        public Duration getDelay()
        Returns the delay between retries. Defaults to Duration.NONE.
        See Also:
        withDelay(long, TimeUnit), withBackoff(long, long, TimeUnit), #withBackoff(long, long, TimeUnit, int)

      • getDelayMultiplier

        public double getDelayMultiplier()
        Returns the delay multiplier for backoff retries.
        See Also:
        #withBackoff(long, long, TimeUnit, int)

      • getMaxDelay

        public Duration getMaxDelay()
        Returns the max delay between backoff retries.
        See Also:
        withBackoff(long, long, TimeUnit)

      • getMaxDuration

        public Duration getMaxDuration()
        Returns the max duration to perform retries for.
        See Also:
        withMaxDuration(long, TimeUnit)

      • getMaxRetries

        public int getMaxRetries()
        Returns the max retries. Defaults to -1, which retries forever.
        See Also:
        withMaxRetries(int)

      • retryOn

        public RetryPolicy retryOn(Class<? extends Throwable>... failures)
        Specifies the failures to retry on. Any failure that is assignable from the failures will be retried.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failures is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if failures is empty

      • retryOn

        public RetryPolicy retryOn(Predicate<? extends Throwable> failurePredicate)
        Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular failure. If the retryPredicate returns true then retries may be performed, else the failure will be re-thrown.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failurePredicate is null

      • retryWhen

        public <T> RetryPolicy retryWhen(BiPredicate<T,? extends Throwable> completionPredicate)
        Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular result and failure. If the completionPredicate returns true then retries may be performed, else the failure will be re-thrown or the result returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if completionPredicate is null

      • retryWhen

        public <T> RetryPolicy retryWhen(Predicate<T> resultPredicate)
        Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular result. If the resultPredicate returns true then retries may be performed, else the result will be returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failurePredicate is null

      • retryFor

        public RetryPolicy retryFor(Object result)
        Specifies when a retry should occur for a particular result. If the result matches result then retries may be performed, else the result will be returned.

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay,
                               long maxDelay,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by a factor of 2.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay is <= 0 or delay is >= maxDelay

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(long delay,
                               long maxDelay,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit,
                               double delayMultiplier)
        Sets the delay between retries, exponentially backing of to the maxDelay and multiplying successive delays by the delayMultiplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalStateException - if delay is >= the maxDuration
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay <= 0, delay is >= maxDelay, or the delayMultiplier is <= 1

      • withDelay

        public RetryPolicy withDelay(long delay,
                             TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the delay between retries.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay <= 0
        IllegalStateException - if delay is >= the maxDuration, or backoff delays have already been set via #withBackoff(Duration, Duration) or #withBackoff(Duration, Duration, int)

      • withMaxDuration

        public RetryPolicy withMaxDuration(long maxDuration,
                                   TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the max duration to perform retries for.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalStateException - if maxDuration is <= the delay

      • withMaxRetries

        public RetryPolicy withMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Sets the max number of retries to perform. -1 indicates to retry forever.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxRetries < -1
